purpose: Highlight the impact of addressing barriers on the advancement of Black employees
title: unknown

bullets.text: Addressing the major barriers that hold back the advancement of Black employees could cut that duration to about 25 years.

supporting_facts: Talent parity = 12% Black representation as calculated for the entire US private sector; if promotion, attrition, and external hiring rates were best-in-class at each level across the participating companies, it would take about 25 years for managerial jobs to reach 12% Black representation overall.
